title: PHPunlink()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPunlink()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Delete a file:
<?php
$file = fopen("test.txt","w");
echo fwrite($file,"Hello World. Testing!");
fclose($file);
unlink("test.txt");
?>
Definition and Usage
The unlink() function deletes a file.
Syntax
unlink(
filename
,
context
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
filename
Required. Specifies the path to the file to delete
context
Optional. Specifies the context of the file handle. Context is a set of options that can modify the behavior of a stream
Technical Details
Return Value:
TRUE on success, FALSE on 
 failure
PHP Version:
4.0+
PHP Changelog:
PHP 5.0 - Added the
context
parameter

★
+1

practice_exercises.title: Complete the Code 1
practice_exercises.description: Fill in the missing line to make this code work.
practice_exercises.starter_code:
<?php
$file = fopen("test.txt","w");
echo fwrite($file,"Hello World. Testing!");
fclose($file);
unlink("test.txt");
# TODO: Complete this line
practice_exercises.solution:
<?php
$file = fopen("test.txt","w");
echo fwrite($file,"Hello World. Testing!");
fclose($file);
unlink("test.txt");
?>

summary: This tutorial covers PHPunlink()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPunlink()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPunlink()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
